template.name: Responder
Victim
Drone
Survivor

nta.system: // System definition system Drone, Responder, Survivor, Victim;

query.formula: Pr[<= T_scs] (<> ((sum(v : id_v_t) Victim(v).Safe) + (sum(v : id_s_t) Survivor(v).Safe)) >= ((VICTIMS_QTY + SURVIVORS_QTY) * Civilians_p_always_safe/100) and globalTime <= T_scs)
query.comment: A percentage Civilians_p_always_safe of all civilians is always guaranteed to reach a safe state within T_scs

plot.title: Probability Density Distribution
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.025, bucket width=0.30769, bucket count=14 Runs: 146 in total, 146 (100%) displayed, 0 (0%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [10, 14] Mean estimate of displayed sample: 11.076 ± 0.1331 (95% CI)

plot.title: Probability Density Confidence Intervals
plot.comment: Parameters: α=0.05, ε=0.025, bucket width=0.30769, bucket count=14 Runs: 146 in total, 146 (100%) displayed, 0 (0%) remaining Span of displayed sample: [10, 14] Mean estimate of displayed sample: 11.076 ± 0.1331 (95% CI)

query.comment: A percentage Civilians_p_helping of all civilians is always guaranteed to help a victim before exiting the map

query.formula: Pr[<= 1000] ([] forall(i : id_s_t) not Survivor(i).Safe imply map[survivors[i].x][survivors[i].y] != FIRE and forall(i : id_v_t) not Victim(i).Safe imply map[victims[i].x][victims[i].y] != FIRE and forall(i : id_f_t) map[responders[i].x][responders[i].y] != FIRE )
query.comment: It is always guaranteed that any person is never in the fire

query.formula: Pr[<= 1000] ([] forall(s1 : id_s_t) forall(s2 : id_s_t) ( s1!=s2 and (not Survivor(s1).Safe) and (not Survivor(s2).Safe) ) imply survivors[s1] != survivors[s2] and forall(r1 : id_f_t) forall(r2 : id_f_t) ( r1!=r2 ) imply responders[r1] != responders[r2] and forall(s : id_s_t) forall(r : id_f_t) ( not Survivor(s).Safe and not Survivor(s).Reaching_victim and not Survivor(s).Helping_with_FR) imply survivors[s] != responders[r] )
query.comment: It is always guaranteed that two people are not in the same cell

query.formula: Pr[<= 1000] ([] (forall(i : id_s_t) !Survivor(i).Safe imply (survivors[i].x < N and survivors[i].y < M) and ((survivors[i].x < N and survivors[i].y < M) imply !Survivor(i).Safe)) and (forall(j : id_v_t) !Victim(j).Safe imply (victims[j].x < N and victims[j].y < M) and ((victims[j].x < N and victims[j].y < M) imply !Victim(j).Safe)) )
query.comment: It is always guaranteed that survivors and victims are outside the map if and only if they are safe

query.formula: Pr[<= 1000] ([] forall(id : id_d_t) bounds[id].min_x >= 0 and bounds[id].max_x < N and bounds[id].min_y >= 0 and bounds[id].max_y < M and drones[id].x >= bounds[id].min_x and drones[id].x <= bounds[id].max_x and drones[id].y >= bounds[id].min_y and drones[id].y <= bounds[id].max_y )
query.comment: It always guaranteed that for each drone bounds are valid and it never goes out of its bounds

query.formula: Pr[<= 1000] ([] forall(i : id_s_t) Survivor(i).Moving imply not tileIsNearSomething(survivors[i], FIRE))
query.comment: It is always guaranteed that a survivor never moves near the fire
